bioghist.p: Father James Donnellon (1906-1971) graduated from Augustinian Academy, Staten Island, in 1924 and from Villanova College in 1930. He pursued his theological training in Washington, D.C. at Augustinian College, and the Catholic University, and was ordained a priest in June 1932. Father Donnellon received an M.S. and a Ph.D. in Biology from the University of Pennsylvania in 1936 and 1938, respectively. He also did graduate studies at Harvard Medical School and at the Marine Biological Laboratory at Woods Hole, Massachusetts. Father Donnellon taught Biology at Villanova College, where he was also chairman of the department at Fordham University. In 1954 he was named president of Villanova College. In June 1959 he was elected Provincial of the Province of Saint Thomas of Villanova and served in that capacity until 1965. He was then appointed Prior of the Augustinian Monastery at Villanova.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Father James A. Donnellon. The collection consists mainly of correspondence on various topics, including letters and questionnaires from the Ford Foundation related to their College Grants program. Other materials in the collection are news clippings on Father Donnellon's appointment as President of Villanova; addresses given by Father Donnellon at commencement ceremonies and before various associations, such as the American Jewish Committee and the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick; materials related to the estate of Eugene L. Garey; a report on accreditation of the Nursing program; and a proposal for a heating system for the Law School.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
